title: I FINALLY DID IT!!!

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

replies.body: He... just did. ô.o
What did he said?
Something to the effect of "now try the real challenge, ranked TT!", apparently overlooking that they already had diamond in ranked TT.
Congratulations! I love 3s, wish it were a more popular map.{{sticker:sg-poppy}}
I didn't even know that sticker existed tbh.

There's a bunch of new ones! They're wonderful.

{{sticker:sg-lux}}
Ugh, why does one of it have to be Dia 4. Demote yourself for the sake of symetry.
When the next lp decay warning comes.
Or maybe promote? smh.
But then he'd need to be toxic to fall into Honor lvl 4
I'm just trying to get Gold V in all queues because I'm bad. All I need to do is get Gold V in Solo/Duo, but that's proving to be pretty hard. :(
Silver isnt easy to climb quickly, even doublelift had to duo just to get out of low elo faster. too many trolls and inters

> [{quoted}](name=Dealth,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BEsyvxYa,comment-id=00100001,timestamp=2017-09-25T06:07:24.569+0000)
>
> Silver isnt easy to climb quickly, even doublelift had to duo just to get out of low elo faster. too many trolls and inters

I wish I could blame it on trolls and intentional feeders, but I can't. I have had one person who ragequit on my side, and two ragequits on the enemy team. Additionally, one time the enemy team started without a top laner for 10 minutes but they still won. So out of all the times I've had an unfair match, I've won 50% of the time. I've had no feeders.

It's really my skills that are holding me back. I'm sinply not good enough at the basic skills of League to climb to Gold V in Solo/Duo.

Just practice 2-3 champions to perfection in your main lanes, try to choose the ones that counter the others counters or can deal with one another.

Also try picking some warding habits and map awareness, for example if you have a trinket ward with you and the bush isn't warded go and ward it. Are there a lot of pings? Check where they are coming from, if its from bot side you can be more aggressive. Don't try to experiment too much with builds in your elo and follow builds that mains use.

There are a lot of other small things that amount to a lot together that will disadvantage you or give you the upper hand in a lane.

For me, the Honor level is stuck or broken or something. I've gotten approx 50+ honors and still no level up.

> [{quoted}](name=LightTrack,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BEsyvxYa,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-09-24T18:36:10.940+0000)
>
> For me, the Honor level is stuck or broken or something. I've gotten approx 50+ honors and still no level up.

Welcome to hell man. Now imagine what it's like when you've been penalized once and, though are "unlocked", can't level even after like 60+ honors and daily playing. You get no hextech l00t, you get shamed by people who think rito has a flawless 100% accurate system and haven't been disillusioned yet like i have (When you report someone out of pure frustration for no reason and they somehow get penalized you kinda just realise that its not exactly the most functional..) etc


sorry dood but looks like riot screwed up the honor system. They spaghetti coded it to work in "mysterious, custom fit ways that adapt to the player" aka it SOMETIMES works but mostly doesnt.

Well i don't have to imagine it. I'm at Honor level 0 thanks to 2 chat restrictions and it's been like this for ages despite me behaving completely fine and positive these few months. And nothing.

PS:In case you're wondering why, it's cuz i was "passive-aggressive".

In other words, i didn't insult anyone. I just made them uncomfortable and that was enough.

As someone D5 in flex and solo and also honour 5, I've been giving strong consideration to venturing into 3v3 land to try to get the same, but considering I've played less than 10 TT games in my entire league life theres a lot of anxiety about screwing up a bunch of matches for people who actually know what they're doing there.

The lack of role select is also pretty scary, since there I'd actually need to be able to play every TT role at a diamond level.
I don't think it is worth it, I'd just keep playing on SR

If you never played TT then don't worry you will be matched with bronze and low silver. It was hell, but it lets you learn it better. 

I was gold last 2 seasons in TT, but matchmaking was reset.
